english: west gate; the West Gate of old Taipei

etymology.description: 西 (west) + 门/門 (gate) = west gate; also a toponym.
etymology.interpretation: Literally the gate on the west side of a city. In Taiwan it also names Taipei’s historic West Gate area (Xīméndīng) and nearby transit stops.
etymology.simplification: 门 is the simplified form of 門, created by reducing stroke count as part of PRC character simplification; the whole word follows this character-level change.

examples.chinese: 他们从西门进城(他們從西門進城)。
examples.english: They entered the city through the west gate.

examples.chinese: 我们在台北西门站集合(我們在臺北西門站集合)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen zài Táiběi Xīmén zhàn jíhé.
examples.english: We’ll meet at Taipei’s Ximen Station.

examples.chinese: 晚上我们去西门町逛街(晚上我們去西門町逛街)。
examples.english: In the evening we’re going to Ximending to stroll and shop.
